alert.note: Alert for Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 1:29PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Georgia and southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, in southeast Georgia, Chatham. In southeast South Carolina, Jasper. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 128 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving showers and thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pooler, Downtown Savannah, Hunter Army Airfield, Hutchinson Island, Savannah International Airport, Windsor Forest, Midtown Savannah, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Bellinger Hill Area, Garden City, Port Wentworth, Thunderbolt, Savannah Historic District, White Bluff, Burroughs, Alabama Junction, Central Junction and Chatham City.
info.instruction: Heavy rain in Downtown Savannah will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.
